channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2023090120
item.description:
Report E-2023090120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a UN2922 AB-73 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the dock floor due to a pinhole puncture. The damaged pail was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Spill Fighter was then utilized to neutralize the impacted area. All impacted pads, cardboard, and cleanup debris were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090167
item.description:
Report E-2023090167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of camp fuel(un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 2 of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 2 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081610
item.description:
Report X-2023081610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded and placed into a Hazardous bag/tote and brought to the damage cage for staging. Then transferred to the hazmat cage for recording. DescribePack: One cap seal has a small hole/ puncture slight. I noticed the original tape was still intact when being inspected. The bottles of alcohol have been packed incorrectly. The bottles were shipped upside down caused the caps to be the base during shipping. Approximately 3 cups have been leaked. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a Hazardous bag/tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080884
item.description:
Report X-2023080884

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the north unload at door 54 where it was leaking inside the trailer and was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA hut to be processed. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a missing cap which caused all liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat bag was placed into a yellow drum where it sit in the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.
